Kellerka thanks for the offer, oh, and I'm not so young - 42 - but the kids are ;-) NanaA thanks for all the info, I hadn't had a chance to look into it much, but that does definitely sound like a good thing.  Hope your treatments continue to go smoothly!

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2009 05:33PM JenniferK wrote: Back from tx#2 and have now been told that I'm HER2+ so I'll be doing Herceptin (sp?) every three weeks for a year on top of everything else.  I'm hoping the Cancer Society (or someone) can provide babysitting services as well as a ride.  It's one thing to ask relative to help out for 6 treatments, but I can't expect them to do it for a whole year ... plus I've got radiation after my July surgery which of course is every day.  It's tough with one car and no sitter :-(

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 06:45PM JenniferK wrote: Hi Rusty123, I started FEC on March 3rd.  The nurse came the next day to give me the shot (which was not a big deal).  She is coming every Wednesday to check up on me and will give me the shot on the Wednesdays after my Tuesday treatments.  I had a bit of hip pain for a couple of days (from the shot), but that was it.  I was taking Procholrazine as an "extra" anti-nausea medicine and it made me bounce off the walls ... we've since switched me to Gravol.  The day of the treatment and the following day I felt pretty good, then a general overall crappy feeling till around Sunday (from Tuesday) and by Tuesday I was excercising.  I've been having to continue taking the Gravol at night so I can sleep and I've been taking Claritin to ward off sinus headaches. Oh, and the hair is still holding in there :-) Jen

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 04:05PM JenniferK wrote: I would agree that you should have it investigated further.  I don't mean to scare you but ... I had a mamogram in September 2006 after finding a lump and I was told there was no thing to worry about.  Now I have a second lump and am told that they are both cancerous.  I have also been told that if it's cancer now, it was cancer then. The only thing that makes me feel any better about that is that had it been found in 2006 we wouldn't have had our beautiful daughter Jordan.
